metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0217 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4 release 2.4.38 and prior, a race condition in mod_auth_digest when running in a threaded server could allow a user with valid credentials to authenticate using another username, bypassing configured access control restrictions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.6').
